title: DPM/FM Dar highlights potential to strengthen Pak-ASEAN ties
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 08 (APP): Acknowledging strong Pak-ASEAN cooperation, Deputy Prime Minister/Foreign Minister Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Tuesday underscored the potential to further deepen ties across diverse areas including trade, tourism, connectivity, IT, and education.
Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Heads of Missions in Pakistan including Myanmar, Brunei Darussalam, Vietnam, Thailand, Philippines, Malaysia, and Indonesia called on the DPM/FM ahead of his participation in the 32nd ARF Ministerial Meeting later this week, Office of the Foreign Office Spokesperson said in a press release.
They also reaffirmed the importance of Pakistanâ€™s partnership with ASEAN and its member states.
